articles.title: Mixing Pfizer, AstraZeneca doses provides strong immune response against COVID-19: study
articles.description: Mixing doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech and AstraZeneca-Oxford vaccines generate a stronger immune response than having two rounds of the AstraZeneca shot, new U.K. research suggests, though the highest antibody response was seen in people being fully vaccinated …

articles.author: Sophia Harris
articles.title: Some Shoppers Drug Mart customers complain they were pushed to use self-checkout — again
articles.description: For the second time in two years, CBC News has heard complaints from Shoppers Drug Mart customers that some of the chain's stores are pushing people to use self-checkout and reserving cashiers for cash payments only.
articles.content:
Michael Kerwin said he was taken aback when at two Toronto-area Shoppers Drug Marts this month, he was told he must purchase his goods using self-checkout  unless he paid with cash.

articles.author: Adam Miller
articles.title: Canada to recommend mixing and matching AstraZeneca, Pfizer and Moderna COVID-19 vaccines
articles.description: Canada is changing its guidelines on mixing and matching second doses of COVID-19 vaccines and will advise Canadians to combine either the AstraZeneca-Oxford, Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna shots interchangeably in certain situations.

articles.author: Adam Miller
articles.title: Why mixing Pfizer and Moderna vaccines could help Canada end the pandemic sooner
articles.description: Canadians who are offered a different COVID-19 vaccine for their second shot than their first shouldn't hesitate to mix and match, experts say, as supply temporarily shifts from Pfizer-BioNTech to Moderna.
